law.catch_line: A license expires on December 31 in each odd-numbered year unless it is renewed for a 2-year term as...

text.section: A license expires on December 31 in each odd-numbered year unless it is renewed for a 2-year term as provided in this section.

On or before December 1 of the year of expiration, a license may be renewed for an additional 2-year term, if the licensee:
Otherwise is entitled to be licensed;
Pays to the Commissioner a renewal fee of $1,000; and
Submits to the Commissioner a renewal application on the form that the Commissioner requires.
The Commissioner shall determine if the requirements of § 12-106 of this subtitle to qualify for a license continue to apply.
The Commissioner may determine that licenses issued under this subtitle shall expire on a staggered basis.
